timeline.message:
fixed null warnings and errors

Signed-off-by: Kai Kreuzer <kai@openhab.org>

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Try it and you will see that it fixes the null warning. If you do a not-null check and then assign the value you have checked to a local var, it will treat the local var as NonNull. It cannot treat hrv as nnNonNull, since it is a field that could potentially change its value to null at any time.
replies.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText: I must say that it also surprises me. Are both maven and Eclipse fine now? Technically that is not correct because a lot can change between checking and assigning given no locking or synchronization seems to be applied.
replies.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText: I'm confused, are you agreeing with me or not?
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: @martinvw Afaik the compiler makes sure that this is the way to make sure that you can safely access a field as nonnull after an if - it only works if it is the very next line after the if.
replies.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText:
I'm confused, are you agreeing with me or not?

If you are talking to me, yes @cpmeister I agree with you.
replies.author: martinvw
martinvw

replies.bodyText: I must say that given someone can break if by adding any statement above I would say its still best practice to do it really local so that it does not depend on this corner case :-)
replies.author: martinvw
martinvw
kaikreuzer
martinvw

replies.bodyText: oof, I just realized my original suggestion was bogus due to my oversight. whoops. Sorry for the confusion.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I did the changes after seeing that the null checker was happy, trust me.
replies.author: kaikreuzer
